page.title: 08Leiston's Blacksmith
page.content: In leiston's high street stands a blacksmiths workshop owned by J.T.Pegg and sons.Three men work there.Sam and Chris Pegg and a young man from the youth training scheme.At the site they make all kinds of things out of metal: Apart from horse shoes they produce wrought iron gates,signs,chains,door latches,shoescrapers,fire screens and and grates and weather vanes. They also make anchors for the fishermen who lose them in rough weather off sizwell beach.Pheumatic drill bits from Sizwell Power Station are brought in to be sharpened on the anvil.The fire is made by burning Smithynuts a special type of coal which is used for heating up the metal before shaping it.
